ygData.subject: Amusing guide anecdote
ygData.msgSnippet: One thing most people don t know is that when you create a new character, your character s name is submitted to a random guide who must either approve or deny
ygData.messageBody:
One thing most people don't know is that when you create a new character,
your character's name is submitted to a random guide who must either
approve or deny your character's name. I believe if no guides are present
it's automatically allowed, but if a guide is around they have a chance to
approve or deny it.

I was guiding on Rodcet the other night and I got a name approval request
for "Charismaqueer" a high elf enchanter. I denied it of course. I then
watched in some amazement as, over the next 20 minute period, this guy
tried every alternate spelling of charismaqueer he could think of.
Karizmaqweer etc. It was kind of amusing to just keep denying him his
name over and over again as he tried to out guess the "computer program"
that he probably figured was denying his name.

Just a little update on my play server while I'm here, I've been having a
pretty good time but I'm trying to relax a little. I've become very
involved in running complicated raids on the plane of hate, plane of fear,
vox, and nagafen. It's really burning me out though so I'm trying to take
a step back and chill. If anyone has any questions about the outer planes
or the dragons, I might be able to answer them though, so feel free to ask
=)

As a total asside to EQ, I visited my family this weekend and watched
"Common Ground", a nice queer positive little made for TV movie starring
Johnathen Taylor Thomas and Jason Priestly amongst other people. I liked
it a lot. My brother was actually an actor in this with a fairly
signifigant part, he played a homophobic highschool student who assaulted
and raped a queer highschool student (JTT).

- Christina (EQ addict)
